Package nl.han.ica.oopg.view

Class CenterFollowingViewport

java.lang.Object
nl.han.ica.oopg.view.Viewport
nl.han.ica.oopg.view.FollowingViewport
nl.han.ica.oopg.view.CenterFollowingViewport
public class CenterFollowingViewport
extends FollowingViewport
This class allows following a GameObject in the Viewport. The Viewport will move if the followed GameObject if the maximum tolerance in a certain direction from its center is reached.

    Create a new CenterFollowingViewport

  • Constructor Details

    • CenterFollowingViewport

      public CenterFollowingViewport​(GameObject followedObject, int zoomWidth, int zoomHeight)
      Create a new CenterFollowingViewport
      Parameters:
      followedObject - The GameObject the Viewport is following.
      zoomWidth - The width in pixels which the viewPort will cut out of the world.
      zoomHeight - The height in pixels which the viewPort will cut out of the world.

    • CenterFollowingViewport

      public CenterFollowingViewport​(GameObject followedObject, int zoomWidth, int zoomHeight, double xOffset, double yOffset)
      Create a new CenterFollowingViewport
      Parameters:
      followedObject - The GameObject the Viewport is following.
      zoomWidth - The width in pixels which the viewPort will cut out of the world.
      zoomHeight - The height in pixels which the viewPort will cut out of the world.
      xOffset - The distance in pixels on the x axis where the center of the followed object is from the center of the Viewport
      yOffset - The distance in pixels on the y axis where the center of the followed object is from the center of the Viewport

  • Method Details

    • createImage

      public processing.core.PImage createImage​(processing.core.PGraphics worldGraphics)
      The method which is called to cut out an image of the drawn world.
      Overrides:
      createImage in class Viewport
      Parameters:
      worldGraphics - The canvas which represents the world from which the viewPort will cut its image out of.
      Returns:
      The cut out image of the world.

      public void setOffset​(double xOffset, double yOffset)
      Sets the offset.
      Parameters:
      xOffset - The distance in pixels on the x axis where the center of the followed object is from the center of the Viewport
      yOffset - The distance in pixels on the y axis where the center of the followed object is from the center of the Viewport
